text: Damn great article
If the Macbook had decent pricing, nobody would probably care
knowing how this  goes, they’ll still sell based on their devoted base
I would buy this Macbook but it's too expensive for what it is
degraded keyboard brought the value down, for one
Sadly they won’t release sales based on non-TouchBar vs. TouchBar. Which would be interesting
I don't care about the Touch Bar
I just want it to be cheaper
give me one with fkeys instead of touchbar (and it’s added price hike) and im more interested in it
you get your function keys with the touch bar
just press fn
like always
I want a keyboard that's fully touch
(but again, it must have excellent feedback)
i like the tactile nature of physical keys
i can navigate my f-row without looking
e.g. volume/mute/brightness etc
right, like I said, excellent feedback
as in, feedback that currently doesn't exist
where's that Apple innovation at?
The older model isn't even cheaper
If you get the 256GB version of the older model, it's exactly the same price as the newer version
i guess they’re trying to close that loophole
And kind of the same specs
Loophole?
apple just hiked their prices here but thats more a brexit thing
_supposedly_
But that hasn't got anything to do with Europe
loophole being ppl going for last year’s model
both apple and microsoft announced price hike due to brexit (allegedly)
whats the bet if the £ recovers they don’t lower their prices :wink:
nah, they care about their consumers
lol j/k
:kappa:
I really wanted a macbook, but now we have 1) increased price 2) removed fn keys and escape (only matters for devs really) 3) no 32gb of ram 4) way too expensive 1TB SSD option
like what the hell
I never thought I would prefer Linux for my next laptop
like the Dell xps 15
the recent xps are fine machines
and i have no love for dell either
me neither but their machines are just very competitively priced
load Elementary OS in there and you have MacBook Pro for ~poor~ reasonable people
I literally get my dream laptop for $2500 from Dell compared to apple

But what most people don't realise is that companies will stop buying macbooks to their employees. Every company I see has a ~£1500 budget for workstation, that's the cheapest macbook pro (8GB ram, no touchbar)
Well it's Apple's call
well yeah, they’re going for margin
losing devs would be a terrible hit
and have been very successful so far
Remember apple has always marketed to "creatives"
selling a dream to everyone in a starbucks writing a script
or making ad-copy
The touch bar seems like it could be a versatile tool for them
I just spoke to someone yesterday who said he has never used the function key
So I am curious to see how normal users will respond to it
prob just be an emoji bar
Well it's still a use case
$400 or whatever premium to send :poop: and :eggplant:
Don't you mean £400? :smirk:
goddammit
/gif broke money

<@U04TK850N> do you hear a slight hiss in the wing earbuds?
not really
It's not really noticeable if you're not focusing on it
You hear it only when there is no sound playing
But when you paused or stopped the music

I had the same "problem" with JBL wireless earbuds that I sent back quite a while back
But that hiss was quite a bit more noticeable
You can really not hear it unless you focus on it after you turn off the music

How wrong can an article even be: <http://www.computerworld.com/article/3136714/data-storage/apples-new-macbook-pro-may-be-the-worlds-fastest-stock-laptop.html>

attachments.title: Apple’s new MacBook Pro may be the world’s fastest stock laptop
attachments.text: Apple has been a leader in using PCIe-based flash storage, which offers far greater bandwidth than SATA-based SSDs. The new 2016 MacBook Pro's specs blow away the performance of its predecessor by nearly double.
attachments.fallback: Computerworld: Apple’s new MacBook Pro may be the world’s fastest stock laptop
